dcterms:creator: Alex Krizhevsky
Geoffrey Hinton
dcterms:description: CIFAR10 is a dataset consisting of 60,000 32x32 color images in 10 different classes, with 6,000 images per class. It is commonly used for training machine learning models in image classification tasks.
dcterms:title: CIFAR10

dcterms:creator: Yuval Netzer
Tao Wang
Adam Coates
Alessandro Bissacco
Bo Wu
Andrew Y. Ng
dcterms:description: SVHN is a real-world image dataset for digit recognition, consisting of over 600,000 labeled digits obtained from house numbers in Google Street View images.
dcterms:title: SVHN

dcterms:creator: Alex Krizhevsky
Geoffrey Hinton
dcterms:description: CIFAR100 is a dataset similar to CIFAR10 but with 100 classes containing 600 images each. It is used for more fine-grained classification tasks.
dcterms:title: CIFAR100

dcterms:creator: Ya Le
Xuan S. Yang
dcterms:description: Tiny-ImageNet is a smaller version of the ImageNet dataset, containing 200 classes with 500 training images per class, used for visual recognition challenges.
dcterms:title: tiny-ImageNet

dcterms:creator: Fisher Yu
Ari Seff
Yinda Zhang
Shuran Song
Thomas Funkhouser
Jianxiong Xiao
dcterms:description: LSUN is a large-scale dataset constructed using deep learning with human input, containing various categories of images for scene understanding.
dcterms:title: LSUN
